section.name: Integrated management
section.p: Loom enables JMX management of your software:

ul.li: All aspects of phoenix itself are manageable, including startup/shutdown, deployment, management and logging.
Applications running in phoenix are manageable, exposing their lifecycle (configuration, startup/shutdown, etc) and everything else you mark as manageable.

section.name: Ease and speed up application development
section.p: Loom is a container for (server) applications. It can host multiple applications within the same JVM, while keeping them securely isolated from each other.
Loom provides simple XML configuration files that allow you to rapidly assemble a customised server applications from readily available components (called blocks).

Loom leverages the Avalon Framework, making it compatible with other Avalon-based projects like Excalibur and Cornerstone, enabling you to easily reuse their functionality.
